title: Returnity dressing: How one fashion editor swapped her maternity wardrobe for a chic new back-to-work look
text:
Twelve months away from the workplace calls for a subtle wardrobe overhaul to keep you looking and feeling ready for action. Emily Cronin has just been on a back-to-work spree

There were at least a dozen tasks I had to accomplish on my last day of maternity leave. But on that day – a day at the end of a year of full-contact, stay-at-home mothering; a day when my older kids were back in school; a day when the baby burbled happily away with our new nanny; a day, in other words, when I had a miraculous seven consecutive hours to myself – I achieved only one item on my list.

I went shopping.

To some, the urge to spend money on new clothes when I had a wardrobe full of garments I’d barely worn for...
description: Twelve months away from the workplace calls for a subtle wardrobe overhaul to keep you looking and feeling ready for action.
